intro: Drosanthemum badspoortense, commonly known as the Badspoortense daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Drosanthemum badspoortense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
